benchmark_details.name: Open-Source Annotated Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: We collect a human-annotated dataset of thousands of captions and processed video frames from multiple person-centric sources.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Enable non-rigid edits of human subject scenes, controllable by text, on in-the-wild data and public datasets.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The model often fails to preserve the identity of the person being edited.

data.source: Collected from Kinetics, NTU-RGBD, Charades, and Fit3D datasets.
data.annotation: Human annotated captions and processed video frames.

methods: Quantitative performance evaluation using FID and PCKh
methodology.calculation: Measured due to constraints in evaluating pose preservation and controllability.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better identity preservation and controllability.
methodology.baseline_results: Image-only model results achieve the best FID but lowest identity preservation.
methodology.validation: Validated through a user study with machine learning raters assessing multiple images.

harm: Potential for creating misleading content such as deepfakes.
